intro: Sondera, commonly known as the African violet, is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is native to tropical Africa. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and showy, tubular flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and thrives in humid, well-drained soil. It prefers indirect sunlight and is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. The leaves are thick and velvety, while the flowers bloom in clusters at the stem tips.
